summary:
The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions 2235 (2015), 2209 (2015), and 2118 (2013), 
condemns the use of toxic chemicals as a weapon in Syria, and reaffirms that such use constitutes a serious violation of international law. 
The Council renews the mandate of the Joint Investigative Mechanism until 18 November 2016, 
and reaffirms paragraphs 1-4, 6-9, 12, and 15 of resolution 2235. 
The Council expresses its intention to consider a further extension of the mandate before its expiration 
and decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
